intro: Acmadenia barosmoides, commonly known as the rock lilly, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Acmadenia barosmoides is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
